name: Fractured Jane Austen Characters Quiz | Literature | 25 Questions

questions.explanation:
Marianne Dashwood.

	She's Elinor's beautiful, accomplished, emotional sister.

Jane Fairfax.

	She's secretly engaged to Frank Churchill.

Mary Musgrove.

	She's Anne's younger sister in 'Persuasion.' She's married to Charles Musgrove.

Colonel Brandon.

	He finally wins Marianne after Willoughby jilts her and she recovers from a life-threatening illness.

Lady Catherine de Bourgh.

	She's Darcy's snooty aunt in 'Pride and Prejudice.'

Fanny Price.

	She's a Cinderella-type character.

questions.correct: Mr. Elton & Mister Elton & Mr Elton
questions.explanation:
Mr. Elton & Mister Elton & Mr Elton

	Emma tries to get him to marry her friend Harriet, but Elton is in love with Emma herself.

Lady Russell.

	She's the one who persuaded Anne not to marry Captain Wentworth the first time he proposed.

Edmund Bertram.

	Fanny's cousin and secret heartthrob.

Catherine Morland.

	The naive but charming heroine of this novel, which is perhaps the least-read Austen book.

Lucy Steele.

	This sly young lady is secretly engaged to Edwards Ferrars, the man Elinor loves.

Admiral Croft.

	Captain Wentworth's genial brother-in-law.

Lydia Bennet.

	Elizabeth's vulgar, flirtatious little sis. She marries her darling Wickham after living with him in sin!

Aunt Norris.

	Fanny's odious, officious aunt. She gets her comeuppance in the end, though! Her darling niece Mrs. Rushworth (Maria Bertram) turns adultress!

Frank Churchill.

	He's Mr. Weston's son and is secretly engaged to Jane Fairfax.

Captain Frederick Wentworth.

	Anne's love in 'Persuasion.'

Elizabeth Elliot.

	She's Anne's vain older sister. She hopes to win Mr. Elliot, but after he realizes he can't marry Anne, he runs off with Mrs. Clay!

Willoughby.

	He's Marianne's unfaithful lover. He also lives in sin with Colonel Brandon's ward! He, Mr. Wickham, and Henry Crawford are Austen's foremost rakes. I wonder if she read Richardson's 'Clarissa' and modeled these characters on Mr. Lovelace.

Isabella Thorpe.

	She's Catherine fair-weather friend who jilts Catherine's brother. However, she gets her comeuppance when Captain Tilney toys with her and drops her.

Charlotte Lucas.

	She's Elizabeth's dear friend who accepts the marriage proposal of silly, obnoxious Mr. Collins after Elizabeth turns him down.

Sir John Middleton.

	He's Mrs. Dashwood's genial, talkative cousin who provides her and her three daughters with a cottage to live in.

Julia Bertram.

	She's the younger of Fanny's two female cousins. She's vain and spoiled like her sister Maria, but is a shade nicer to Fanny.

Miss Bates.

	She's perhaps the most chatty Austen character. She talks on and on an ON about the most trivial topics. (I know a couple of people like this, and you probably do, too.)

Henrietta Musgrove.

	She's one of the Anne's sister's sisters-in-law. She ends up marrying her cousin, Charles Hayter.

Georgiana Darcy.

	Darcy's little sister almost runs off with unprincipled Mr. Wickham.
